Module chav1961.purelib
Package chav1961.purelib.i18n

Class AbstractLocalizer

java.lang.Object
chav1961.purelib.i18n.AbstractLocalizer
All Implemented Interfaces:
SpiService<Localizer>, Localizer, java.lang.AutoCloseable
Direct Known Subclasses:
DebuggingLocalizer, DummyLocalizer, FileSystemLocalizer, MutableJsonLocalizer, PropertiesLocalizer, XMLLocalizer
public abstract class AbstractLocalizer
extends java.lang.Object
implements Localizer

This is an abstract class to implements any localizers. This class supports a lot of localizer's functionality described (see Localizer). Current localization support in the class includes English and Russian localization content

Since:
0.0.2
Author:
Alexander Chernomyrdin aka chav1961
See Also:
Localizer, JUnit tests
LastUpdate:
0.0.4

      Get list available keys in the current Localizer only

      Specified by:

      Returns:
      list of the defined keys. Can't be null. It's content is joined from all added/pushed localizers.

    • getValue

      public java.lang.String getValue​(java.lang.String key) throws LocalizationException, java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Description copied from interface: Localizer

      Get localization value for the given key. Extracts and substitute values (see SubstitutableProperties) from localization content. Also processed a set of URLs inside the localization string. Each url inside the localization string has syntax:

      url(<valid_url>[,<valid_MIME>])

      Relative URL (with the missing scheme) points to resource inside the JRE class tree. Duplicated keys in the localizer hierarchy always are resolved to the deepest localizer content

      Specified by:
      getValue in interface Localizer
      Parameters:
      key - key to get localization string for. Key content is case-sensitive
      Returns:
      string localized
      Throws:
      LocalizationException - if the key is missing anywhere.
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if key to get is null or empty

    • getValue

      public java.lang.String getValue​(java.lang.String key, java.lang.Object... parameters) throws LocalizationException, java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Description copied from interface: Localizer

      Get localization value for the given key. Extracts and substitute values (see SubstitutableProperties) from localization content. Also processed a set of URLs inside the localization string. Each url inside the localization string has syntax:

      url(<valid_url>[,<valid_MIME>])

      Relative URL (with the missing scheme) points to resource inside the JRE class tree. Duplicated keys in the localizer hierarchy always are resolved to the deepest localizer content

      Specified by:
      getValue in interface Localizer
      Parameters:
      key - key to get localization string for. Key content is case-sensitive
      parameters - additional parameters for string formatter
      Returns:
      string localized
      Throws:
      LocalizationException - if the key is missing anywhere.
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if key to get is null or empty

    • getContent

      public java.io.Reader getContent​(java.lang.String key, MimeType sourceType, MimeType targetType) throws LocalizationException, java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Description copied from interface: Localizer

      Get and convert localization value for the given key as Reader. Valid MIME types to source MIME are:

      • text/plain [charset=...]
      • text/x-wikicreole [charset=...]

      Valid MIME types to target MIME are:

      • text/plain
      • text/html
      Specified by:
      getContent in interface Localizer
      Parameters:
      key - key to get localization content for
      sourceType - MIME type for the source content (for example 'text/x-wikicreole charset=UTF-8;')
      targetType - MIME type for the target content (for example 'text/html')
      Returns:
      localized content
      Throws:
      LocalizationException - if the key is missing anywhere or conversion errors at the runtime
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if key to get is null or empty, also unsupported or unknown conversion combination

    • add

      public Localizer add​(Localizer newLocalizer) throws LocalizationException, java.lang.NullPointerException, java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Description copied from interface: Localizer

      Add new localizer to the current level of the hierarchy. Adding the localizer doesn't change it's own parent, siblings and children. Parent for the localizer to add will be set to this parent.

      Specified by:
      add in interface Localizer
      Parameters:
      newLocalizer - localizer to add.
      Returns:
      self
      Throws:
      LocalizationException - localizer to add has duplicated keys at the given hierarchy level
      java.lang.NullPointerException - localizer to add is null
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the localized already was added

      Add new localizer to the current level of the hierarchy. Adding the localizer doesn't change it's own parent, siblings and children.

      Returns:

    • remove

      public Localizer remove​(Localizer localizer) throws LocalizationException, java.lang.NullPointerException, java.lang.IllegalStateException
      Description copied from interface: Localizer

      Remove the localizer from any level of the hierarchy. Removing the localizer doesn't remove it's children from it. Parent of the localizer to remove will be cleared

      Specified by:
      remove in interface Localizer
      Parameters:
      localizer - localizer to remove
      Returns:
      self
      Throws:
      LocalizationException - when any localization problems were detected
      java.lang.NullPointerException - localizer to remove is null
      java.lang.IllegalStateException - localizer was removed earlier or was not added

    • push

      public Localizer push​(Localizer newLocalizer) throws LocalizationException, java.lang.NullPointerException, java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Description copied from interface: Localizer

      Create new level or the hierarchy, and push localizer here. Localizer added can be removed by Localizer.remove(Localizer) or by Localizer.pop(Localizer) method. If child level of the hierarchy already exists, simply adds new localizer in it. Parent for the localizer to push will be set to this localizer. Duplicated keys in the localizer blind the same keys in the hierarchy tail

      Specified by:
      push in interface Localizer
      Parameters:
      newLocalizer - localizer to push.
      Returns:
      Added localizer. Calling Localizer.close() on this instance should automatically calls the Localizer.pop(Localizer) method on the 'parent' localizer
      Throws:
      LocalizationException - when any localization problems were detected
      java.lang.NullPointerException - localizer to add is null
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the localized already was added

    • push

      public Localizer push​(java.net.URI newLocalizer) throws LocalizationException, java.lang.NullPointerException, java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Description copied from interface: Localizer

      Create new level or the hierarchy, and push localizer here. Localizer added can be removed by Localizer.remove(Localizer) or by Localizer.pop(Localizer) method. If child level of the hierarchy already exists, simply adds new localizer in it. Parent for the localizer to push will be set to this localizer. Duplicated keys in the localizer blind the same keys in the hierarchy tail

      Specified by:
      push in interface Localizer
      Parameters:
      newLocalizer - localizer URI to push
      Returns:
      Added localizer. Calling Localizer.close() on this instance should automatically calls the Localizer.pop(Localizer) method on the 'parent' localizer
      Throws:
      LocalizationException - when any localization problems were detected
      java.lang.NullPointerException - localizer to add is null
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the localized already was added

      public ContinueMode walkUp​(Localizer.LocaleWalking processor) throws java.lang.NullPointerException, LocalizationException
      Description copied from interface: Localizer

      Walk Localizers tree from the current to the root. Every sibling (but not it's children) on every level need be processed.

      Description copied from interface: Localizer

      Walk Localizers tree from the current to all the children. Every sibling on every level need be processed.

      Specified by:

    • close

      public void close() throws LocalizationException
      Description copied from interface: Localizer

      Close the localizer. Localizer to close purges it's notification list, removes self from parent localizers and calls Localizer.pop() method on the 'parent' localizer

      Specified by:
      close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
      Specified by:
      close in interface Localizer
      Throws:
      LocalizationException - any errors when processing
